page.title: 09 Building
page.content: {Architecture:}There are some very nice {Georgian}and{Victorian}houses in{Long {Bennington.}There are several pre_war council houses.Since{1970}a few private estates have been built, blending in quite well with the existing buildings. Nothing too extreme is allowed,and develoment is restricted as part of the village is a conservation area. The oldest house in the village dates from{1550.}It was originally a farmhouse and has recently been restored. There are two{cruck houses in the village and a house with a {mansard roof. Crosburn House}is the only listed building in the village. There used to be a{Dame School}at the end of Sparrow Lane. There was a cottage hospital in the village which closed before{World War I.
